stream_context.summary: Kaze works on a new cut-scene in Return to Yoshi's Island where Bowser introduces a boss that eats Mario and spits him into the battle arena, while also discussing a separate YouTube content idea.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is scripting a cut-scene in which a boss swallows Mario and transports him to the fight arena. After talking to Bowser, the player emerges to a suddenly silent area before the boss appears, creating tension.
development_findings.quote: Right now what we're trying to do is we are making the cut scene where the boss eats Mario and spits you out at the scene where you fight them.

development_findings.summary: The cut-scene currently has a bug where the boss model does not appear as intended, indicating ongoing debugging.
development_findings.quote: Oh god you can't even see him. He was supposed to come meet you. Okay… it's a work in progress.

development_findings.summary: A custom music track is planned for the pre-boss area to heighten atmosphere.
development_findings.quote: And the argument switch around Moses office should have some funky music… yeah it will definitely have a custom song.

context_findings.summary: Kaze will attend a wedding next week, so he plans to start the next stream earlier and end it sooner.
context_findings.quote: I have a wedding to attend next week so I might actually start stream like half an hour early and I'm probably gonna have to cut it early too next week.

context_findings.summary: He is developing a ‘Mr Beast-style’ video titled something like 'I hacked every N64 game in one day', illustrating his approach to YouTube marketing and willingness to exaggerate for entertainment.
context_findings.quote: It's literally just gonna be a lie though, I don't care though, it doesn't matter.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses excitement about YouTube membership icons and audience interaction.
context_findings.quote: Dude the membership icons on YouTube are so cool.

context_findings.summary: The stream was temporarily suspended for policy violations after playing an Evangelion song, causing frustration and highlighting copyright sensitivities.
context_findings.quote: Stream suspended for policy violations… because of the Evangelion song. That is very not good.

key_stories.title: Bugged Boss Introduction
key_stories.summary: Kaze demonstrates a new cut-scene where Bowser complains about lazy minions, sends in a giant boss, and Mario is swallowed into the fight area. The boss fails to appear, revealing a work-in-progress glitch.
key_stories.challenge: Create an immersive, story-driven transition into a boss battle.
key_stories.process: Scripted dialogue with Bowser, environment audio changes, programmed boss entrance and swallow animation.
key_stories.outcome: Boss model currently invisible; debugging needed.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh god you can't even see him. He was supposed to come meet you.

key_stories.title: Mr Beast-Style N64 Hacking Video
key_stories.summary: Kaze outlines an ambitious click-bait concept to 'hack every N64 game in one day' using rapid-fire, humorous cheat demonstrations across 25 titles.
key_stories.challenge: Produce viral, high-energy content that appeals to a broader YouTube audience.
key_stories.process: Select 25 games, design short gag cheat codes, frame segments with Mr Beast pacing and narration.
key_stories.outcome: Concept pitched on stream; six games and cheats already chosen, needs 19 more.
key_stories.key_quote: I hacked every nintendo 64 game and this is what happened.

key_stories.title: Copyright Strike Interruption
key_stories.summary: The stream is abruptly suspended when an Evangelion track triggers YouTube’s policy violation system, forcing Kaze to pause development and address the issue.
key_stories.challenge: Accidental use of copyrighted music during live development.
key_stories.process: Stream auto-paused by YouTube; Kaze and Zeina discuss waiting or restarting.
key_stories.outcome: Unclear within transcript; highlights ongoing risk of licensed music.
key_stories.key_quote: Stream suspended for policy violations… because of the Evangelion song.

open_questions.context: Kaze shows an unfinished sequence where the boss eats Mario and spits him into the arena, but details on inspiration, technical implementation, and final vision are sparse.
questions: What inspired the idea of being eaten and transported to the boss arena?
What technical steps are required to synchronize camera, animations, and level transitions?
How will the cut-scene integrate with gameplay pacing and difficulty tuning?

open_questions.topic: Custom music for the Bowser office area
open_questions.context: Kaze mentions a "funky" custom song is planned.
questions: What mood and instrumentation is envisioned for this track?
Is Badub composing it, and how does he translate design briefs into N64-compatible music?
What limitations exist for music size and quality on the original hardware?

open_questions.context: Kaze pitched a click-bait video idea on stream.
questions: How does creating viral YouTube content align with or distract from game development?
What criteria will Kaze use to pick the remaining 19 games and cheat gimmicks?
Is the exaggeration (“in one day”) purely marketing, or will he attempt a timed challenge?

open_questions.topic: Stream policy violations and contingency plans
open_questions.context: The stream was suspended due to copyrighted music.
questions: How often do copyright strikes disrupt development streams?
What protocols will Kaze implement to prevent future interruptions?
Has this affected his approach to incorporating fan or licensed music in the project itself?
